episodeTitle: Epic, Heated Combat! The Fateful Final Conclusion!
description: Luffy defeats Foxy in the final round of the Davy Back Fight by reflecting his Noro Noro Beam with a mirror and finishing him with Gomu Gomu no Flail. After reclaiming Chopper and Robin, the Straw Hats leave Long Ring Long Land as Tonjit reunites with his grandson.

events.title: Luffy Discovers Mirror Shard
events.description: Luffy discovers he has a piece of mirror stuck in his afro from his earlier visit to Foxy's room. This becomes the key to turning the tide of the battle.
events.significance: Provides Luffy with the tool to counter Foxy's Noro Noro Beam, demonstrating tactical thinking in combat.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy realizes he can use the mirror against Foxy

events.title: Luffy Reflects Noro Noro Beam
events.description: Foxy casts another Noro Noro Beam, but Luffy uses the mirror shard to reflect the beam back onto Foxy, turning his own Devil Fruit power against him.
events.significance: Demonstrates the weakness of the Noro Noro no Mi and showcases Luffy's ability to exploit enemy weaknesses during battle.

quotes.text: Your beam won't work on me anymore!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy taunts Foxy after reflecting the beam

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Flail Debut
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Flail for the first time, spinning his arm in a circle at high speed before driving his fist into the slowed Foxy. The crowd counts down as the slowness effect wears off, launching Foxy into the air.
events.significance: First use of this technique, which becomes part of Luffy's combat arsenal. The delayed impact due to Foxy's slowed state creates a devastating finishing blow.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first use of this technique to defeat Foxy

events.title: Foxy's Defeat and 920-Win Streak Ends
events.description: Foxy lands out of bounds and is unable to move within ten seconds, losing the final round of the Davy Back Fight. His legendary 920-win streak comes to an end.
events.significance: Concludes the Davy Back Fight arc and establishes Luffy's victory over a veteran pirate. Foxy's crew, who had never seen him lose, witnesses his first defeat.

events.title: Chopper and Robin Reclaimed
events.description: Following his victory, Luffy reclaims Tony Tony Chopper and Nico Robin from the Foxy Pirates, reuniting the Straw Hat crew.
events.significance: Restores the Straw Hat Pirates to their full roster after the temporary separations during the Davy Back Fight.

events.title: Rittonto's Arrival
events.description: A giant mole emerges from underground, ridden by a young boy. Tonjit recognizes him as his grandson Rittonto, who has become the world's best hole digger in the ten years since they were separated.
events.significance: Anime-only addition that provides closure to Tonjit's story arc. In the manga, Admiral Aokiji appears instead, but the anime moved that encounter to a separate location.

quotes.speaker: Rittonto
quotes.context: Emotional reunion after ten years of separation

events.title: Tonjit and Rittonto Reunion
events.description: Tonjit and his grandson Rittonto tearfully embrace after being separated for ten years. Rittonto explains how he became a champion hole-digger to cope with his loneliness and eventually find his grandfather.
events.significance: Provides emotional closure to Tonjit's storyline and demonstrates themes of family bonds and perseverance. Shelly, Tonjit's loyal horse, is also reunited with them.

events.title: Departure from Long Ring Long Land
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates set sail from Long Ring Long Land, continuing their journey to find a shipwright. They leave behind Tonjit, Rittonto, and the Foxy Pirates.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Long Ring Long Land Arc and transitions the story toward the next major arc.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy reminds the crew of their quest

quotes.speaker: Itomimizu
quotes.context: Declaring Luffy's victory in the Davy Back Fight

quotes.speaker: Rittonto
quotes.context: Emotional reunion with Tonjit after ten years

themes.description: Luffy refuses to give up despite being outmatched by Foxy's tactics, ultimately finding a creative solution to win.
themes.symbolism: The mirror represents turning an enemy's strength into their weakness through clever thinking.

themes.description: Luffy fights fiercely to reclaim his crewmates, demonstrating the bond between the Straw Hat Pirates.
themes.symbolism: The reunification of the crew symbolizes the unbreakable bonds of their friendship.

themes.description: Tonjit and Rittonto's emotional reunion after ten years shows the enduring nature of family love.
themes.symbolism: Rittonto's dedication to hole-digging, initially born from loneliness, transforms into the means of reuniting with his grandfather.

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist - Victor of Davy Back Fight
characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates growth in tactical combat by exploiting Foxy's Devil Fruit weakness with a mirror.
keyActions: Discovers mirror shard in his afro
Reflects Noro Noro Beam back at Foxy
Debuts Gomu Gomu no Flail technique
Defeats Foxy and ends his 920-win streak
quotes: Your beam won't work on me anymore!

characterSpotlights.development: Experiences his first loss in 920 Davy Back Fights, learning the limits of relying solely on his Devil Fruit power.
keyActions: Launches Noro Noro Beam at Luffy
Gets hit by his own reflected beam
Suffers defeat via Gomu Gomu no Flail

characterSpotlights.development: Makes his debut appearance, reuniting with his grandfather after ten years of searching.
keyActions: Shares story of becoming a hole-digger

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, Admiral Aokiji appears after Luffy's victory to help Tonjit. In the anime, this role is replaced by Tonjit's grandson Rittonto, an anime-only character. Aokiji's introduction is moved to a later anime-original arc.
The anime extends the battle sequences and adds more reaction shots from the crowd compared to the manga's more concise presentation.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the end of Foxy's 920-game winning streak in Davy Back Fights, making Luffy the first opponent to ever defeat him.
Gomu Gomu no Flail debuts in this episode as one of Luffy's techniques, though it would be used sparingly in future battles.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Rittonto is an anime-only character created to replace Admiral Aokiji's manga appearance, as the anime staff decided to introduce Aokiji in a later arc.
The episode adapts manga chapters 317-318, which conclude the Long Ring Long Land Arc in the manga.
The Japanese TV rating for this episode was 10.9%, ranking 7th in its time slot.
